Award.AwardTitle: EAGER: A Social and Context Aware Spectrum Management Framework for Heterogeneous Cognitive Radio Networks

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
Cognitive radio is a promising technology that can significantly alleviate spectrum scarcity and improve the spectral efficiency. This project conducts a comprehensive study on developing a social and context aware spectrum management framework that targets maximizing the spectral efficiency for cognitive radio networks with heterogeneous devices and applications. This research is motivated by the idea that the efficient management of spectrum requires the consideration of the entire network ecosystem where the users and their applications interact with each other. In the proposed framework, a novel fairness criterion is developed for the network scenarios under consideration. With the developed fairness criterion as a constraint, a social and context aware spectrum allocation scheme is developed, which contributes to the maximization of the spectral efficiency. In addition, a fair opportunistic spectrum sharing mechanism is proposed to further improve the spectral efficiency. Lastly, various aspects of social bonding in a group of users are exploited to reduce the delay occurred in the spectrum sharing process.

The expected results of this project include novel algorithms, designs, and technologies to enable the future deployment of commercial cognitive radio networks and new emerging applications. The findings of this project will be disseminated through journal and conference publications. The developed hardware and software tools will be made available to the research community at large as well. The project integrates research and education with the intent of training undergraduate students. It also outreaches to high school students in the local area.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Intellectual Merit:

The objective of this research is to develop a social and context aware spectrum management framework that targets maximizing spectral efficiency for wireless networks with heterogeneous devices and applications. Intellectual results obtained in this project include 7 papers in the field of wireless networking and communications: i) One paper on fairness criterion analysis and spectrum access sharing has been published, where the connections between the four major types of fairness criteria are analyzed and proved; ii) One paper on energy efficient context sensing and fusion for Android based mobile devices has been published. The proposed scheme has been implemented and has the potential to be adopted by Android; iii) One paper on efficient channel access and sharing has been published; iv) One paper on distributed deterministic broadcasting algorithms has been accepted; v) One paper on relay selection for cooperative cognitive radio networks is under review; vi) One paper on low overhead and stable clustering schemes has been published. Its journal version is under review. These research results can benefit the adoption and the future deployment of cognitive radio networks. Moreover, these results can be applied to other areas in wireless networking and communications as well. Lastly, a few cognitive radio based laboratories have been developed for education purposes. These developed labs can help enhance the education in cognitive radio networks and other areas of wireless networking and communications. Two of these laboratories have been used in an undergraduate level wireless course and the demonstration to high school students. 

Broader Impacts:  

This project has provided training and professional development opportunities to a number of undergraduate students. Among these students, two of them are minorities from underrepresented groups, three of them are female, two of them come from economically disadvantaged backgrounds, and one of them is a military veteran. These students involve in various activities such as research paper reading, discussion and presentation, algorithm learning and design, software development, and writing research papers. These students are able to learn the fundamentals of conducting research and gain valuable research experiences. Notably, one student has published a conference paper related to this project as the first author. In addition, this project helps the students identify their future career path and research interests. Particularly, one student has been admitted to the Ph.D. program of a national research university with full scholarship because of his active involvements in this project. Lastly, the PI has presented the research results to college students in various classes and high school students from the local area.
